com.intel.icecp.node.channels.ndn.chronosync.algorithm

Class ChronoSynchronizer<T extends State>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intel.icecp.node.channels.ndn.chronosync.algorithm.ChronoSynchronizer<T>

  • public class ChronoSynchronizer<T extends State>
extends Object
    A network-agnostic implementation of the ChronoSync protocol. See http://named-data.net/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/chronosync-icnp2013.pdf for details.

    To use this synchronization protocol over a network transport: 

    
     ChronoSynchronizer<X> synchronizer = new ChronoSynchronizer<>(tree);
     synchronizer.observe([tie this to user application]);
     synchronizer.startRequesting([send digest bytes here]);

     // when an incoming digest is received...
     synchronizer.onReceivedDigest(digest, [send state bytes here]);

     // when incoming digest + states are received...
     synchronizer.onReceivedState(digest, state)

     // when the user changes states
     synchronizer.updateState(state);

    TODO optimize Timer--is it always needed? TODO synchronize observers

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ChronoSynchronizer.IncomingPendingRequest<T>
      API for executing transmission-specific code to satisfy incoming requests; though this is very similar to Observer, it is kept separate to distinguish the different functions they fill
      static interface  ChronoSynchronizer.Observer<T>
      API for notifying observers that states have changed
      static interface  ChronoSynchronizer.OutgoingRequestAction
      API for executing transmission-specific code to send synchronization requests

        Parameters:

      • onReceivedDigest

        public void onReceivedDigest(Digest digest,
                             ChronoSynchronizer.IncomingPendingRequest<T> request)
        Handle incoming requests. Requests sent by remoteObservers clients contain a digest representing their latest state. If our local state is different than theirs, we respond with our digest and the set of states that would bring them up to date with us.
        Parameters:
        digest - the latest digest of the remoteObservers client
        request - the remoteObservers client's request, to be satisfied when we can answer with a newer state

      • onReceivedState

        public void onReceivedState(Digest digest,
                            Set<T> complement)
                     throws SynchronizationException
        Handle incoming state sets. A remoteObservers client will see our request and send us this response if they have an updated state
        Parameters:
        digest - the latest digest of the remoteObservers client
        complement - the states to add to bring us to the same digest as the remoteObservers client
        Throws:
        SynchronizationException - if the complement does not bring us to the expected digest

      • notifyLocalObservers

        protected void notifyLocalObservers(Digest digest,
                                    Set<T> states)
        Notify all local observers
        Parameters:
        digest - the newly synchronized digest
        states - the changed states

      • satisfyPendingRequests

        protected void satisfyPendingRequests(Digest digest,
                                      Set<T> states)
        Notify and remove all remote observers; TODO should this just retrieve the latest digest and states?
        Parameters:
        digest - the newly synchronized digest
        states - the changed states
